intro: Lepidium beckii, commonly known as the narrowleaf peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs. Lepidium beckii is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
